I think that the Imperial staff has already said that.  I certainly 
hope that the Emperor doesn't waste his time on this loser.  When the 
truth comes out, I'd expect that dork to lie about some other claim 
to fame.  Maybe he was dubbed a Conquistador by the King of Spain 
too.

Brandon
--- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, "Kyle Segall" <
klancesegall@y...> wrote:
> What's "chanbara"?
> 
> And whats going to happen when the emperor says, "uh, no, i didnt 
> make this guy a samurai, i cant do that anyways cuz they dont exist 
> anymore"?
> 
> --- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, "Kitsuno" <samurai-
> listowner@s...> wrote:
> > It looks like that article from the sun a while back about the 
guy 
> > claiming to be a samurai was serious, albeit stupidm of course:
> > 
> > http://www.japantimes.co.jp/cgi-bin/
getarticle.pl5?fl20040203zg.htm
> > 
> > And most importantly:
> > 
> > "However, the Office of the Imperial Household has told The Japan 
> > Times that it has no practice or system of granting such titles.
> > 
> > The samurai class ceased to exist 130 years ago, with the 
> abolition 
> > of Japan's feudal system at the end of the Tokugawa Shogunate in 
> > 1868."
